Off-peak water heating.

title: Local Quality
text:
Consider the utility of each feature. 

Different parts of the object may perform different functions.

A knife has a handle and a blade.
A pencil with an eraser.
A claw hammer.

title: Asymmetry
text:
Make the design asymmetrical.

Would asymmetry improve ergonomics?
Would asymmetry improve stability?
Is wear concentrated or spread out?

The kitchen cupboards open outwards.
Scissors can be right or left handed.

title: Merging
text:
Merge the operations of similar objects. 

Make similar objects identical. 

Make operations parallel.

A phone is also a camera and a torch.
Makeup combined with SPF sunscreen.

title: Universality
text:
Design features to have multiple functions.

The Spork, Heelys, The Swiss Army Knife.
Adjustable Wrenches & Multi-Bit Screwdrivers.

Use a spade to row a boat.
 Use an axe as a door stop.

title: Matryoshka
text:
Nest objects within themselves.
Use Recursion.

Extendable ladders.
Retractable landing gear.
A stack of bowls.
Fractals.
Merge Sort.

title: Anti-weight
text:
Compensate for weight.
Add features to reduce weight.
Improve functions that create lift

Buoyancy Control Devices for diving.
Aerated and Cored bricks.
Aerospace.

title: Preliminary Anti-actions
text:
Prevent failure modes before they occur.
Arrange processes to protect outcomes.

Applying sunscreen before going outside.
Using painter's tape.
Grocery shopping with an N95.

title: Preliminary Actions
text:
Perform a function before the output is required.
Actions to speed up subsequent tasks.
Anticipate and prepare.

'Heat and Eat' zero prep frozen dinners.
Preset document templates.
Proximity detecting automated doors.
Providing hand tools with flat pack furniture.

title: Beforehand Cushioning
text:
Features to change impulses into gradients.
Reduce the impacts of sudden change.
Contingency plans.

Scheduled data backups and UPS.
Backup parachutes. Air bags. Pre-nups.
Using summer to prepare for winter.

title: Equipontentiality
text:
Limit position changes during transfer processes.
Level set information for the audience.
Avoid heavy lifting.

Canal locks. Mechanic Pits. Chest of Drawers.
JDAs with corresponding technical and business owners.

title: The Other Way Round
text:
Doing things backwards.

Drilling with a lathe.
Air pumps that can both inflate and deflate.
Features implemented based on market pull.

title: Curvature
text:
Compare linear and rotary approaches.
Make processes cyclical.
Use centrifugal forces.

Kick off a sprint with a retrospective.
Screws vs nails. Washing Machines. Architectural arches.

title: Dynamics
text:
Self optimising processes.
The ability to adapt to change
Make the inflexible, flexible.
Balancing good, fast, and cheap, for optimal output

Gooseneck mounts. In-line custom engraving.
Video game joystick and mouse tuning.

title: Partial or Excessive Actions
text:
When the required output requires difficult precision, functions to produce more or less output can make the problem easier.
The 80:20 Rule.

Painting the area over a stencil.
Over-engineering for robustness.

title: Another Dimension
text:
Reorienting a feature to explore a new solution space.

Organization structures that prioritise process or feature.

FM vs AM radio. Multi-layered PCBs.
Braille. Arthritis assistive devices.

title: Mechanical Vibration
text:
Introduce vibration or oscillation to simplify or reinvigorate a process.

Electric toothbrushes. Blenders and mixers.
Focused ultrasound surgery.
Lane indicating rumble strips.

title: Periodic Action
text:
Convert continuous processes into a series of discrete actions.
Reconsider the frequency of periodic actions.

ABS brakes. Off-peak water heaters. Hammers.
Scheduled maintenance. Batch processing.

title: Continuity of Useful Action
text:
Reduce downtime with continuous processes.
If something needs to warm up, keep it warm!

Dummy loads. Fly wheels. Capacitors.
Circular saws always move in the cutting direction.

title: Skipping
text:
When a process includes undesirable side effects, finish it as fast as possible.
Rip off the bandage. Fail fast, fail early.
Use rapid changes to your advantage.

Flash photography. 
Quenching metal for strength and hardness.
Laser eye surgery.
Would you prefer a syringe injection or a drip?

title: Convert Harm into Benefit
text:
Turning lemons into lemonade.
Finding the blessing in disguise.
Using harmful factors for positive effect.

Controlled burns to prevent wildfires.
Recycling one product to make another.
Using excess engine heat to warm the vehicle cabin.

title: Feedback
text:
Use past events to determine present behavior.

Negative feedback loops can maintain a setpoint.
Temperature controlled HVAC.

Positive feedback loops can amplify output.
Hendrix Woodstock 1969.

Retrospectives can combine both.

title: Intermediary
text:
To better facilitate the interaction between two or more components, introduce an additional component for the duration of the interaction.

Coasters. Gloves.
Paper Clips not Staples.
Neutral third parties during negotiation.

title: Self-service
text:
An object or process providing its own support.
Making use of waste materials, users, or energy, generated by a process.

Composting. HTTP Cookies.
Self check-out aisles. ATMs.
Automated doors. Auto-saving documents.
Pump your own gas.

title: Copying
text:
Substitute unavailable objects or processes with available copies.

Cheap over expensive. Safe over dangerous.
Available over busy. Accessible over remote.

Streaming music instead of going to a concert.
Video conferencing vs meeting in person.
Using camera drones for inspection.
Sonograms vs explorative surgery.

title: Cheap or Short-lived
text:
Replace expensive items with cheap, short-lived substitutions that are replaced regularily.
Find where quality compromises can be made.
Is replacing cheaper than maintaining?

Seasonal employees for perdiods of high demand.
Paper plates and plastic cutlery.
Disposable diapers. Disposable batteries.

title: Mechanical Substitution
text:
Replace a feature's mechanics with an alternative means.

Propane with mercaptan scent for leak detection.
Radio-based highway toll collection.
Haptic notifications. Brushless motors.
Magnetic securing mechanisms.
Invisible dog fence collar.
